title: Why I'm Upset at Netflix's New Documentary "Take Your Pills"
description:
Controversy sells, and the media knows it. So a lot of what we see, read about, and hear about ADHD and ADHD treatment either misrepresents the facts or is flat-out meant to scare us.  

Netflix's new documentary "Take Your Pills" (interview w/producers: https://youtu.be/L-cq_HKdQwc) is no exception. This is why I'm upset: Despite bringing up many legitimate concerns, the film contributes to the confusion, stigma and fear around stimulant medication — many of the experts included either don’t have a background in research, directly benefit from spreading fear & misinformation about ADHD treatment, or speak on subjects outside their area of expertise. 

This is a problem, because — as this study found (https://www.liebertpub.com/doi/abs/10.1089/cap.2012.0087) — “Inaccurate and sensationalized media reports surrounding ADHD and its treatments [have] a major impact on parental decision making” when it comes to treatment. 

Fortunately, a TON of research has been done on stimulant medications, so you and your doctor can decide what’s right for you or your child based on facts, not fear. 

This is Dr. Hallowell’s full response to “Take Your Pills:” https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V6hhH8zkFfM&feature=youtu.be 
Dr. Hallowell is a psychiatrist and leading ADHD expert who’s written over 20 books on ADHD, including “Driven to Distraction” and “Delivered From Distraction” and is finishing up his memoir, which you can pre-order here: http://www.drhallowell.com/free-sample-chapter-dr-hallowells-memoir/

Remember, documentaries aren’t peer-reviewed. And not all research studies are created equal. 

Here’s a guide to understanding research studies: 
http://www.chadd.org/Understanding-ADHD/About-ADHD/The-Science-of-ADHD/Understanding-Research-Studies.aspx

Here are some reliable sources of information about ADHD and ADHD treatment: 
ADHD facts: https://add.org/adhd-facts/
What we know about the long-term effects of ADHD medication: https://childmind.org/article/know-long-term-effects-adhd-medications/
Why dosage matters: https://childmind.org/article/is-your-child-getting-the-right-medication-dose/
Types of ADHD medication: https://www.understood.org/en/learning-attention-issues/treatments-approaches/medications/types-of-adhd-medications
Why stimulants help ADHD (Sci Show, includes research):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yoX0vEDn5a4&feature=youtu.be
“Getting Ahead of ADHD” by Dr. Joel T. Nigg (fantastic book on treating childhood ADHD, includes non-medication options & talks about meds starting p224): https://www.amazon.com/Getting-Ahead-ADHD-Next-Generation-Treatments/dp/1462524931/ref=mt_paperback?_encoding=UTF8&me=
The difference between the effect of amphetamines & methamphetamines: http://www.jbc.org/content/284/5/2978.full.pdf
What actually causes addiction? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ao8L-0nSYzg
And here is a systematic review that includes 69 recent (2011-2016) studies related to ADHD treatment: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmedhealth/PMH0098860/

Citations: 

Kemper, A. R., Maslow, G. R., Hill, S., Namdari, B., Allen LaPointe, N. M., Goode, A. P., … Sanders, G. D. (2018). Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder: Diagnosis and Treatment in Children and Adolescents. Rockville (MD): Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (US). Retrieved from http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK487761/

Clavenna, A., & Bonati, M. (2017). Pediatric pharmacoepidemiology - safety and effectiveness of medicines for ADHD. Expert Opinion on Drug Safety, 16(12), 1335–1345. https://doi.org/10.1080/14740338.2017.1389894

Merkel, R. L., & Kuchibhatla, A. (2009). Safety of stimulant treatment in attention deficit hyperactivity disorder: Part I. Expert Opinion on Drug Safety, 8(6), 655–668. https://doi.org/10.1517/14740330903279956

Merkel, R. L. (2010). Safety of stimulant treatment in attention deficit hyperactivity disorder: part II. Expert Opinion on Drug Safety, 9(6), 917–935. https://doi.org/10.1517/14740338.2010.503238


Swanson, J. M., Arnold, L. E., Molina, B. S., Sibley, M. H., Hechtman, L. T., Hinshaw, S. P., Abikoff, H. B., Stehli, A. , Owens, E. B., Mitchell, J. T., Nichols, Q. , Howard, A. , Greenhill, L. L., Hoza, B. , Newcorn, J. H., Jensen, P. S., Vitiello, B. , Wigal, T. , Epstein, J. N., Tamm, L. , Lakes, K. D., Waxmonsky, J. , Lerner, M. , Etcovitch, J. , Murray, D. W., Muenke, M. , Acosta, M. T., Arcos‐Burgos, M. , Pelham, W. E., Kraemer, H. C., , , Severe, J. B., Richters, J. , Vereen, D. , Elliott, G. R., Wells, K. C., Conners, C. K., March, J. , Cantwell, D. P., Gibbons, R. D., Marcus, S. , Hur, K. , Hanley, T. and Stern, K. (2017), Young adult outcomes in the follow‐up of the multimodal treatment study of attention‐deficit/hyperactivity disorder: symptom persistence, source discrepancy, and height suppression. J Child Psychol Psychiatr, 58: 663-678. doi:10.1111/jcpp.12684

title: Try Different (The Fish Song) – A Song For ADHD Brains
description:
Well, I did it! I practiced my ukelele! And now I've written you all a song. I'm still very new at this so be nice :) Also the title says "A Song for ADHD Brains" but really this song is meant for anyone whose brain works a lil differently. #neurodiversity

Get “Try Different (The Fish Song)” below!

iTunes: http://bit.ly/fishsongitunes

Google Music: http://bit.ly/fishsonggp

Amazon: http://bit.ly/fishsongamazon

Download the sheet music for “Try Different (The Fish Song)”:
http://bit.ly/fishsongmusic

Listen to Sean Rosenberry's awesome music: https://www.barryscrossing.com/

My Webinar with ADDA:
https://add.org/an-adda-special-event

Episode on creating habits (like practicing the ukelele!): https://youtu.be/nxjKup00oF8

Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd

title: How to Create a New Habit: Note From Future Self
description:
Having trouble creating a new habit? Future Jessica travels back in time to warn me of how MY new habit goes terribly, terribly wrong -- but it doesn't HAVE to. 

(Psst, Future Jessica!  Here are my notes for the habit loop!)
Habit Loop Bujo pages:
http://bit.ly/HTADHDhabits

*****

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

*****

Links!!

The Power of Habit (book): http://charlesduhigg.com/the-power-of-habit/

Charles Duhigg at TEDx: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OMbsGBlpP30

The Habit Loop: http://habitica.wikia.com/wiki/The_Habit_Loop

Why Habits Are Hard to Make and Break: http://news.mit.edu/1999/habits

Choosing a Cue (Trigger): https://jamesclear.com/habit-triggers


Extrinsic vs Intrinsic motivation: https://www.verywellmind.com/differences-between-extrinsic-and-intrinsic-motivation-2795384

50 Ways to Reward Yourself for Studying: https://blog.4tests.com/50-ways-reward-studying/

50 non-food rewards for exercising: http://www.sparkpeople.com/resource/motivation_articles.asp?id=1990

How to Make Work Habits Stick:https://zapier.com/blog/work-habits-stick/

Using rewards to help your kid practice: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/using-rewards-to-motivate-piano-practice/

title: 5 Ways Dogs Help ADHD Brains -- in 360 Degrees!!!
description:
Link to last video on the terretorio de zaguates:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gsew6RhXhMw

Dogs can be wonderful for ADHD brains! 

But a lot of these benefits depend on you having a good relationship with your dog, so make sure you choose one that’s right for you and your family. Do as much research ahead of time as possible and make sure you meet your new family member in person before you commit!

http://www.akc.org/find-a-match/#slide1

http://www.animalplanet.com/breed-selector/dog-breeds/questionnaire/page1.html

picking a puppy (VIDEO): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J9khrqxVpAc

picking a shelter dog (article): http://3lostdogs.com/a-guide-to-choosing-the-right-dog-from-a-shelter/

WARNING: There are many “registries” that are essentially scams. You do NOT need to register your emotional support animal, or have a vest or ID card for them. All you need is a letter from your doctor or therapist explaining why you need one.  

For service animals, which autistic people often benefit from, you do not need a vest either, although many handlers choose to use one. What makes a service dog a service dog is the specialized training they go through to provide a specific task or tasks to assist with their handler’s disability and be able to behave in public places. 

More on service dog scams: http://servicedogcentral.org/content/fake-service-dog-credentials

Right to Emotional Support Animals in "No Pet” Housing:

http://www.bazelon.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/2017-06-16-Emotional-Support-Animal-Fact-Sheet-for-Website-final.pdf

More on emotional support animals: http://www.akc.org/content/entertainment/articles/everything-about-emotional-support-animals/ 

Link to Fair Housing Act: https://www.hud.gov/sites/documents/SERVANIMALS_NTCFHEO2013-01.PDF

Laws in other countries: https://assistancedogsinternational.org/access-and-laws/adi-guide-to-assistance-dog-laws/

Canada (opinion piece, provides links): http://helpmentalhealth.squarespace.com/canadian-laws/

What’s The Difference Between a Service Dog, Therapy Dog, and an Emotional Support Animal? (VIDEO) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4C459sQwrAo&feature=youtu.be

More about service dogs: https://www.huffingtonpost.com/janice-celeste/service-dogs-not-allowed-_b_8062976.html

What NOT to do around service dogs (video by Drew Lynch): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U9PqaaIBjq0

Find an assistance dog! 

International: https://www.assistancedogsinternational.org/

Canada: http://www.cagads.com/programs.html

THE LIST OF STUDIES

Gadomski, A. M., Scribani, M. B., Krupa, N., Jenkins, P., Nagykaldi, Z., & Olson, A. L. (2015). Pet Dogs and Children's Health: Opportunities for Chronic Disease Prevention?. Preventing Chronic Disease, 121-10. doi:10.5888/pcd12.150204

Gadomski, A. M., Scribani, M. B., Krupa, N., & Jenkins, P. (2017). Pet dogs and child physical activity: the role of child-dog attachment. Pediatric Obesity, 12(5), e37-e40. doi:10.1111/ijpo.12156

Martin, K. E., Wood, L., Christian, H., & Trapp, G. A. (2015). Not Just "A Walking the Dog": Dog Walking and Pet Play and Their Association With Recommended Physical Activity Among Adolescents. American Journal Of Health Promotion, 29(6), 353-356. doi:10.4278/ajhp.130522-ARB-262

Lundqvist, M., Carlsson, P., Sjödahl, R., Theodorsson, E., & Levin, L. (2017). Patient benefit of dog-assisted interventions in health care: a systematic review. BMC Complementary & Alternative Medicine, 171-12. doi:10.1186/s12906-017-1844-7

Schuck, S. B., Emmerson, N. A., Fine, A. H., & Lakes, K. D. (2015). Canine-assisted therapy for children with ADHD: preliminary findings from the positive assertive cooperative kids study. Journal Of Attention Disorders, 19(2), 125-137. doi:10.1177/1087054713502080

Sugawara, A., Masud, M. M., Yokoyama, A., Mizutani, W., Watanuki, S., Yanai, K., & ... Tashiro, M. (2012). Effects of Presence of a Familiar Pet Dog on Regional Cerebral Activity in Healthy Volunteers: A Positron Emission Tomography Study. Anthrozoos, 25(1), 25-34.

Dogs in the workplace: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5451949/

Special thanks to Alex and Duckie for consulting and providing links and research on this video! Puppy kisses, mwah!

title: How to Rebuild Your Routines When Everything Changes
description:
Routines are super helpful for ADHD brains, so  when they get disrupted it can throw everything off. Here’s how to rebuild your routines when life changes! 

Links!

title: 2 Year YouTube Anniversary Rewind + Special Unboxing!

title: Why Routines Are More Helpful Than New Years’ Resolutions
description:
While making New Years’ resolutions can be fun, there’s a tool that’s way more powerful when it comes to making positive change in your life — building routines for yourself. 

Special thanks to our research consultant Patrick LaCount for advising on this episode!

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

LINKS! 

TimeTune: https://timetune.center/
Brili: https://brili.com/

Meme credit (special thanks to Sherri Barras for tracking this down!): http://hyperboleandahalf.blogspot.com/2010/06/this-is-why-ill-never-be-adult.html

ADHD and executive function: https://www.understood.org/en/community-events/blogs/expert-corner/2016/05/11/the-new-thinking-about-adhd-and-executive-functioning?gclid=EAIaIQobChMIjfnOhKW12AIVEHR-Ch2lSgBDEAAYASAAEgJ4F_D_BwE

http://www.chadd.org/understanding-adhd/about-adhd/executive-function.aspx

Dr. Barkley explains executive function & ADHD: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GR1IZJXc6d8

Tips for creating routines (adults): https://psychcentral.com/blog/archives/2013/04/02/9-tips-for-creating-a-routine-for-adults-with-adhd/

Tips for creating routines (for kids): https://www.everydayhealth.com/add-adhd/create-a-daily-routine-for-children-with-adhd.aspx

title: Bujo Update + Tips From the Inventor of the Bullet Journal!
description:
Hello Brains!

Well, I've been using the bullet journal for a year, and I still love it! Yay for sticking to something! I have also run into some challenges, so I thought -- who better than Ryder Carroll, the inventor of the bullet journal himself, to help me tackle them! 

If you have questions for Ryder, leave them in the comments using #bujo and he might answer them in a future video!

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

LINKS! 


Ryder Carroll's website: http://bulletjournal.com/

title: How to ADHD Merch is Finally Here!!!!!!!!!
description:
Hello Brains and Hearts!
If you've been wondering where I've been -- now you know!
Edward and I have been in our secret workshop making How to ADHD merch, aaand we may have gotten a bit carried away (ALL THE THINGS!):

https://howtoadhd.com/shop

The site is a bit confusing at first but is awesome once you get the hang of it.

Here's the deal: click on the link then click on "shop." That will show you a sampling of cool products and give you the ability to search by department (men's, women's, stationary, etc.) or by product "show me stickers!"

Orrrrr you can click on "portfolio" and view the different "collections." "Collections" is their fancy way of saying designs. In the portfolio, you can click on whatever design you're interested in and then below that it will show you all the stuff you can get that design printed on  :D

You can also get a 10% off your full first order if you join their mailing list!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

LINKS:

merch store: https://howtoadhd.com/shop
free downloadable for phones: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/14W0Tg2uenywAD19Abd_71S2oU_rY4CBp
Excuse letter (why it's not here yet): https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PxOnqDWEE_z1SLh0V_oTgPxGM4ggbVwb/view

"The Show Must Be Go”

title: 3 Ways to Be Grateful (That Don't Involve Gratitude Lists)
description:
Happy Thanksgiving!!

I've tried to make gratitude lists a bunch of times, but they always end up making me feel more stressed out (or pressured to feel grateful) than actually grateful. I always thought I was weird and probably should not admit that so people wouldn't assume I'm a horrible, ungrateful person -- but then I realized -- I'm really not! I'm actually pretty happy! Turns out, there are lots of ways to be grateful and happy about your life. Here are a few I use and love!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

title: Why I'm Grateful to You (Thank You!!!)
description:
Hello Brains and Hearts!

Today is Thanksgiving where I live, so I created an episode on 3 ways to be grateful (that don't involve gratitude lists). It's...not ready quite yet, so it will be up later today, but one of the ways was to write thank-you notes, so this is my thank you note -- to you. This is why I'm grateful to all of you for sharing, commenting, subscribing, subtitling, volunteering, and supporting this show in all the ways you do. 

**spoilers**


I'm posting this one first because I'm about to head in to work (yeahhh, servers have to work on holidays) and do something I've been working toward for a very long time, and I wanted to connect with you and thank you before I do.


-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

title: This is What It's Really Like to Have ADHD
description:
My recent TED Talk got picked up on Facebook and renamed "This is is what it's really like to have ADHD," but that was just my story.  ADHD isn't just one story – it's the stories of thousands of people around the world.  It's the stories of children, of college students, of adult adhd.  It's more than their symptoms: it's the story of their struggles and their successes. 

These are some of those stories.

If this message means something to you, please share.

If you'd like to know more, please visit:
http://howtoadhd.com/howtohelp

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

AD(H)S ist nicht nur eine Geschichte - es sind die Geschichten von tausenden Menschen auf der ganzen Welt. Es sind die Geschichten von Kindern, von Studenten und von Erwachsenen mit AD(H)S. Es ist mehr als deren Symptome: Es sind die Geschichte ihrer Probleme und Erfolge.

Dies sind einige dieser Geschichten.

title: UK Brains -- what you can do now to improve ADHD treatment!
description:
UK Brains -- this episode is just for you! I hear from so many of you who are frustrated with how long it takes to get an ADHD diagnosis in the UK and how misunderstood it is. Michelle Beckett of the new charity ADHD Action is fighting hard to change that! 

Sign the petition! 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/202061

ADHD Action:
http://adhdaction.org
http://facebook.com/adhdaction

Michelle Beckett speaking to Parliament:
http://adhdaction.org/the-speech-at-conference

Share this TED talk to improve ADHD understanding! 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JiwZQNYlGQI

Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd

title: UPDATE on the ADHD School Guidance We Worked to Save!!
description:
Many of you have been asking what happened to the ADHD School Guidance (the Dear Colleague Letter and Resource Guide) we all worked so hard to save -- 
thanks to teacher-brain Jo Meleca-Voigt, we finally have an update!!! 

Of course, there's always more to do to advocate -- 

Share this TED talk with your local school district to help them understand ADHD:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JiwZQNYlGQI

UK Brains -- sign this petition!! 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/202061

MORE LINKS!

The school guidance we worked to save: https://www2.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ocr/letters/colleague-201607-504-adhd.pdf

Our video explaining the guidance: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PM2ebKO7yYM&app=desktop

Our video explaining why it was on the chopping block: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pY_-zaLeSPA&t=55s

72 other regulations *were* rescinded which may affect students with disabilities, including ADHD: https://www.additudemag.com/department-of-education-rescinds-policies-that-help-students-with-disabilities/

List of rescinded regulations: https://www2.ed.gov/documents/press-releases/regulatory-reform-task-force-progress-report-2.pdf

Dept of Education explanation: https://www.ed.gov/news/press-releases/department-education-withdraws-outdated-subregulatory-guidance

US News Report: https://www.usnews.com/news/education-news/articles/2017-10-27/education-department-to-withdraw-600-out-of-date-guidance-documents

Education Week: http://blogs.edweek.org/edweek/speced/2017/10/special_education_guidance_eliminated.html

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

"The Show Must Be Go”, "Life of Riley", "Happy Happy Game Show"
Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

title: Does Sugar Make Kids Hyperactive? (Special Halloween Episode!)
description:
Ah, the age old debate: "does sugar make kids hyperactive?" 

LET'S SETTLE IT!  HALLOWEEN STYLE!

*cue rock music*

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

Citations:

Flora, S.R., & Polenick, C.A. (2013) Effects of sugar consumption on human behavior and performance.  The Psychological Record, 63, 513-524. doi:10.11133/j.tpr.2013.63.3.008

Wolraich, M. L., Wilson, D. B., & White, J. W. (1995). The effect of sugar on behavior or cognition in children: A meta-analysis. The Journal of the American Medical Association, 274, 1617-1621. doi:10.1001/jama.1995.03530200053037

Sciutto, M.J. (2015) ADHD Knowledge, Misconceptions, and Treatment Acceptability. Journal of Attention Disorders, 19(2), 91-98.  doi: 10.1177/1087054713493316

Hoover, D. W., & Milich, R. (1994). Effects of sugar ingestion expectancies on mother-child interactions. Journal of Abnormal Child Psychology, 22, 501-515. doi:10.1007/BF02168088

SPECIAL THANKS to Rachelle LeDuc and Patrick LaCount for contributing the research for this episode! 

And thanks to Pnospric who busted another myth in the comments section by pointing out poisoned candy isn't actually a thing, either -- 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OzFRwevQEB0  


Chocolate bar designed by Vecteezy

"The Show Must Be Go”, "Life of Riley", "March of the Spoons"
Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

title: October Live Stream Announcement! Ask Me Anything!!!
description:
Edward accidentally published a private livestream publicly, and when Edward makes a mistake, you win, because there WILL be a public live stream on Saturday, October 21st at 2PM PST (9PM UTC).

Submit your questions here: http://bit.ly/HTADHD-Oct2017-QnA

If you want to submit a video for the HUGE BRAIN COLLAB, you have until October 18th at midnight your time! (whenever that is for you!)

Check out the information at the end of this video for how to submit your video to the HUGE BRAIN COLLAB: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=icITlP3iS6U

title: THE TEDX VIDEO IS HEEEEERE!!!!
description:
My TEDx talk is up!!!

Please watch and share: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JiwZQNYlGQI

HUGE BRAIN COLLAB!

Record a video (on an iPhone, a computer, whatever you have!) with the following information:
1. Your name and how to spell it
2. What you want people to know about your ADHD (less than 15 seconds, please!)

(Don't include a timer in the video, Edward was being extra helpful and possibly very confusing)

Upload it to YouTube and email the link to us at howtoadhd@gmail.com by Wednesday October 18th at midnight (wherever you are), and we'll include it in the Huge Brain Collab!

title: ADHD and Emotional Dysregulation: What You Need to Know
description:
Emotions and emotional dysregulation are something you don't usually read about when learning about ADHD – and there's a reason why!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

CITATIONS/LINKS:

Barkley, B. A. (2015) Emotion Dysregulation is a Core Component of ADHD. In R. A. Barkley (Eds.), Attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder: A handbook for diagnosis and treatment (4th ed.). New York, NY, US: Guilford Press.

ADHD and Anger: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Aq7RNaB0DQ

How to Make Better Decisions through Mindfulness: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AJwn0WrqAhI

Emotion Tracker!  https://bit.ly/3D5fFVO
Super Heart Award (blank) http://bit.ly/HTADHDSuperHeartAward
Super Heart Award (like Jessica's) http://bit.ly/HTADHDSuperHeartAward2



Explanation of how cognitive behavioral therapy helps: http://www.cbtdbtassociates.com/problems-addressed/emotion-regulation/

Explanation of how cognitive behavioral therapy helps: http://www.cbtdbtassociates.com/problems-addressed/emotion-regulation/



Emotional dysregulation and ADHD:
https://www.additudemag.com/emotional-instability-a-core-symptom-of-adhd/
https://www.google.com/amp/adhdinadults.com/emotional-dysregulation-and-adhd/amp/

Article about the connection between ADHD and ODD: 
http://www.ptscoaching.com/articles/does-adhd-have-to-lead-to-oppositional-defiant-disorder/

Lecture by Dr. Barkley on emotional regulation: http://adhdlectures.com/lecture-view.php?LectureID=16

How does mindfulness improve emotional regulation: https://greatergood.berkeley.edu/article/item/How_does_mindfulness_help_control_behavior

Why mindfulness meditation is important to help us be mindful: 
https://www.mindful.org/meditation-keeps-emotions-in-check/

Easy app to practice mindfulness meditation: Headspace.com

Link to a review article on emotional dysregulation: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12402-016-0199-0

How mindfulness meditation improves emotional regulation and decreases substance abuse: http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0376871616001174


ADHD or bipolar? 
https://www.additudemag.com/adhd-bipolar-symptoms-overlap/

"The Show Must Be Go”, "Professor Umlaut", "Carefree", "Doobly Doo", "Enter the Maze", "Life of Riley"
Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

localizations.es-419.title: ADHD y desregulación emocional: Lo que necesitas saber
localizations.es-419.description:
Las emociones y la desregulación emocional es algo que no se lee usualmente cuando se aprende sobre el ADHD - y hay una razón porque!

=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

LINKS DE CITAS:
Barkley, B. A. (2015) Emotion Dysregulation is a Core Component of ADHD. In R. A. Barkley (Eds.), Attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder: A handbook for diagnosis and treatment (4th ed.). New York, NY, US: Guilford Press.

ADHD and Anger: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Aq7RNaB0DQ

How to Make Better Decisions through Mindfulness: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AJwn0WrqAhI

Emotion Tracker! http://bit.ly/HTADHDEmotionTracker
Super Heart Award (blank) http://bit.ly/HTADHDSuperHeartAward
Super Heart Award (like Jessica's) http://bit.ly/HTADHDSuperHeartAward2

Explicación de como la terapia cognitiva del comportamiento ayuda:
http://www.cbtdbtassociates.com/problems-addressed/emotion-regulation/

Desregulación emocional y ADHD
https://www.additudemag.com/emotional-instability-a-core-symptom-of-adhd/
https://www.google.com/amp/adhdinadults.com/emotional-dysregulation-and-adhd/amp/

Artículo sobre la conección entre ADHD y ODD:
http://www.ptscoaching.com/articles/does-adhd-have-to-lead-to-oppositional-defiant-disorder/

Conferencia del Dr. Barkley sobre regulación emocional: http://adhdlectures.com/lecture-view.php?LectureID=16

Como el mindfulness mejora la regulación emocional: 
https://greatergood.berkeley.edu/article/item/How_does_mindfulness_help_control_behavior

Porque la meditación mindfulness es importante para ayudarnos a ser conscientes: 
https://www.mindful.org/meditation-keeps-emotions-in-check/

Aplicación fácil para practicar meditación minfulness: Headspace.com

Link a un artículo de revisión sobre desregulación emocional: 
https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12402-016-0199-0

Como la meditación midfulness mejora la regulación emocional y disminuye el abuso de sustancias: 
http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0376871616001174

title: How to Get Projects Done, On Time, Without Your Life Falling Apart in the Process
description:
One of the biggest challenges ADHD brains face is project management -- in the past I've always tried harder, worked faster, stuffed more into my schedule. 

But maybe there's a better way -- deciding which projects aren't even worth taking on in the first place. 

This video is meant to help us get projects done, on time, without the rest of your life falling apart in the process.

Special thanks to research consultant Patrick LaCount

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

Links!!!

Should I Do the Thing? PDF: https://drive.google.com/file/d/16sBF8j94eJ1LlLXBC9y4Eh7-up2MNlNQ/view

Submit questions for tomorrow's Livestream (Aug 28 5pm Pacific, midnight UTC): [Stream Passed]



"The Show Must Be Go”, "Life of Riley", "Angel Share", "Sunflower Dance Party", "Waltz of Treachery FX", "Clash Defiant",
Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)

http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

title: How to ADHD's First Song! It's About Being Nervous About Writing One
description:
Hey Brains!

This is Jessica's first recording of her first song ever!  (Audio only)

She just started learning the ukelele this year so she could write songs for the channel, but she was so nervous about writing her first one someone suggested she write about that!

It was originally posted as a Patreon behind the scenes piece, but since the recording of the song at Vidcon didn't turn out, we thought we'd share it for you here.

Have a great day!

title: How to Grab the Best Job for an ADHD Brain!
description:
The second and final part of Dr. Ned Hallowell's How to ADHD interview!

This week, we discuss how to find the right job for you, and how to KEEP IT. :D  Dr. Hallowell also talks about what makes ADHD special, and how best to approach disclosing your attention deficit hyperactivity disorder to your boss.

Huge, huge, huge thanks to the amazing support from our Patreon Brains.  Because of their help, we could hire someone to film Dr. Hallowell in his office, and get a much sharper, more clear episode with him.

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd

title: How to ADHD with Special Guest Dr. Hallowell!!!!
description:
This week, How to ADHD presents an incredible special guest -- Dr. Ned Hallowell! 

Dr. Hallowell is a very busy man -- not only a leading ADHD expert, but a New York Times bestselling author who's written 20 books, many of them on ADHD. 

But thanks to the generous support from our Patreon Brains, we were able to have someone film him in his New York office while chatted over Skype about living with ADHD, how to deal with the sensitivity to rejection that often comes with it, and the importance of connection. 

You all ROCK. 

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

title: How to Homework: Top 10 Tips for ADHD Success
description:
Hello Brains! Since it’s been awhile since I’ve had to do homework myself (aaaand I was never all that great about doing it to begin with!) I partnered with Nobel Coaching to make our very first sponsored video — with all the VidCon excitement happening, this video would not have been possible without their help!

LINKS:
Nobel Coaching: http://nobelcoaching.com

Quizlet: https://quizlet.com/
Kahoot: https://kahoot.it/#/
Quia: https://www.quia.com/

Fun way to learn languages: https://www.duolingo.com/

Educational YouTube channels:

title: How to ADHD on the Road: VidCon 2017 DAY TWO
description:
VIDCON DAY TWO ARRIVED!  

(And so did we, late last night)

The panel on mental health went GREAT (we have it recorded, but the quality is a bit rough – we found out last minute that it wasn't going to be streamed, and Edward rigged up some iPhones to capture it).  Let us know in the comments if you'd like to see some of it!

Tomorrow is an open day for us – which means Edward will be doing more editing, and we'll be roaming Vidcon looking for more brains to hug!

title: How to ADHD on the Road: VidCon 2017 DAY ONE
description:
Auuughhhhh VidCon is FINALLY HERE!!!!!

...but we're not. 

Or...we are, but we weren't earlier. Vlogs are not quite real time. 

ANYWAY!

They let us out of the studio and onto the stage -- I was invited to be a featured creator at VidCon, which meeeeans they paid for our tickets and rooms so we could come speak -- about mental health! 

My first panel (and time speaking live as some sort of ADHD expert) is tomorrow -- wish me luck and look for a DAY TWO blog tomorrow night!

title: How Exercise Can Help with ADHD (and How to Actually Do It)
description:
Exercise is one of the most-suggested natural treatments for ADHD, and for good reason. Although experts agree that it’s not usually enough to replace stimulant medication for most people who need it, it does affect the brain in much the same way. Still, exercising regularly can be a challenge for those of us with ADHD -- so I cover some tips that can help! 
 
Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd
 
LINKS:

Attention & Learning Lab: http://uwyoall.com 

Studies: 
 
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5281644/
 
Den Heijer, A., Groen, Y., Tucha, L., Fuermaier, A., Koerts, J., Lange, K., . . . Tucha, O. (2017). Sweat it out? The effects of physical exercise on cognition and behavior in children and adults with ADHD: A systematic literature review. Journal of Neural Transmission, 124, S3-S26.
 
http://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/1087054715584053
 
Neudecker, C., Mewes, N., Reimers, A. K., & Woll, A. (2015). Exercise intervention in children and adolescent with ADHD: A systematic review. Journal of Attention Disorders. 
 
Books: https://www.amazon.com/Spark-Revolutionary-Science-Exercise-Brain/dp/0316113514
 
Ratey, J. J. & Hagerman, E. (2008). Spark: The revolutionary new science of exercise and the brain. Little Brown & Company
 
Articles: 
 
How exercise helps ADHD:
https://www.additudemag.com/exercise-and-the-adhd-brain/
http://www.webmd.com/add-adhd/guide/adult-adhd-and-exercise#1
 
How exercise beefs up the brain: http://www.sciencemag.org/news/2013/10/how-exercise-beefs-brain
https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/02/160208083606.htm
 
Explanation of neurogenesis: 
http://www.bioedonline.org/news/hot-topics/adult-neurogenesis/
 
Yoga for kids with ADHD: https://www.additudemag.com/yoga-for-kids-with-adhd/
 
Video:
 
You can grow new brain cells: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B_tjKYvEziI&feature=youtu.be
 
Research Consultants for this episode:
Patrick A. LaCount, M.S. 
Liz Lemon
 
"The Show Must Be Go,” “Professor Umlaut,” “DooblyDoo,” “Life of Riley,” “Volatile Reaction” 
Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

tags: ['add', 'adhd', 'attention deficit hyperactivity disorder', 'jessica mccabe', 'how to', 'diagnose', 'adult', 'diagnosis', 'grown up']
title: What it's Like to be Diagnosed with ADHD as an Adult
description:
I was diagnosed when I was 12, so I don’t have the experience of being diagnosed with ADHD as an adult -- but ADHD coach Brett Thornhill does! Now that my channel is reaching more brains (and hearts!) I wanted to make an episode that might help them understand what it’s like -- not only the actual process, but the emotional journey. In this episode, Brett Thornhill opens up about his own experience and I mostly try to stay out of his way.
 
Brett’s website: http://embraceyouradhd.ca
Brett’s article on what can help ADHD brains: (this is in his email) 
Why it’s important to seek a diagnosis even as an adult: https://www.additudemag.com/better-late-than-never-adults-with-adhd/

localizations.de.description:
Ich wurde diagnostiziert als ich 12 Jahre alt war, deshalb habe ich nicht die Erfahrung, wie es ist, als Erwachsene(r) mit ADHS diagnostiziert zu werden - aber ADHS Trainer Brett Thornhill hat sie! Jetzt, wo mein Kanal mehr Brains (und Hearts!) erreicht, wollte ich eine Episode machen, die euch vielleicht hilft zu verstehen, wie das ist  - nicht nur der eigentliche Prozess, auch die emotionale Reise. localizations.no.title: Hvordan det var å bli diagnostisert med ADHD som voksen.
localizations.no.description:
Jeg var diagnostisert når jeg var 12 år, så jeg har ikke erfaringen med å bli diagnostisert med ADHD som voksen - Men coach Brett Thornhill har det! Nå som min kanal rekker ut til flere hjerner (og hjerter!) ville jeg lage en episode som kunne hjelpe med å forstå hvordan det er. Ikke bare den faktiske prosessen, men også den følelsesmessige reisen. I denne episoden åpner Brett Thornhill opp om hans erfaring, og jeg prøver for det meste å la han snakke i fred.

Brett’s nettside: http://embraceyouradhd.ca

title: What I Want to Say to My Mom, Who “Drugged” Me
description:
Whether (or how) to treat a child with ADHD is an understandably tough decision for many parents. My mom decided to, and faced (as many parents do) judgement for her choices. Here’s what I want to say to her, and every parent who finds themselves accused of “drugging” their children. 

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

Links to reliable sources of information on ADHD:
http://understood.org
http://chadd.org
http://add.org
http://additudemag.com

My video on Zombie ADHD myths & the truth behind them: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V5tLi1bYilA

And if you were one of the people who were hurt or offended by Nicole Arbour’s video (if not, it’s not worth watching/giving her views, it’s just one of her typical misinformed rants),
An excellent explanation of why she’s wrong: 
https://debunkingdenialism.com/2017/05/08/why-nicole-arbour-is-wrong-about-adhd/

My Little Villagers' response: http://mylittlevillagers.com/2017/04/response-nicole-arbours-video-truth-adhd/

Thank you to my Patreon supporters, for the sake of keeping this video short and shareable I didn't do my usual intro or wrapup, but I could not have done this without all of you. 

By the way, in case anyone is curious -- I take Vyvanse now, but I started on Ritalin. 

Transcript of video:

What I want to say to my mom, who "drugged" me:

Thank you. Thank you for listening when I told you I was struggling. Thank you for standing up for me when my dad tried to dismiss what I was dealing with as "normal." I now understand ADHD is highly genetic and it's likely he felt that way because he probably had ADHD himself.

Thank you for taking me to get a proper evaluation so I understand my brain's differences and don't feel like it's just all my fault. Thank you for taking me to a psychiatrist, month after month, to find a treatment and dose that worked for me. And for taking me back month after month after month after month -- I know you were busy, and yet I never ran out of medication because you took the time to take me to every appointment.

Thank you for ignoring the people who judged you. I know there were many.

Thank you for understanding that there was a difference between my sister occasionally forgetting her homework and me losing or forgetting something almost every day. Thank you for understanding that while all children can be fidgety or impulsive or get distracted, I struggled way more than the other kids my age. I now understand it's because ADHD brains develop differently. 

You didn't know that, you hadn't done the research I have, but you listened to me when I told you I needed help.

Because of you, I got the treatment I needed, I did better in school, I felt more confident and able to reach my potential. Because of you, I never had to self medicate like so many ADHDers I know. I never sank into depression. I never gave up on myself. I never felt misunderstood. You understood. You believed me. 

And when you did, when you took me to a doctor who could explain to me what was happening in my brain, you took away so much shame.

Thanks, mom.
caption: true
localizations.en.title: What I Want to Say to My Mom, Who “Drugged” Me
localizations.en.description:
Whether (or how) to treat a child with ADHD is an understandably tough decision for many parents. My mom decided to, and faced (as many parents do) judgement for her choices. Here’s what I want to say to her, and every parent who finds themselves accused of “drugging” their children. 

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

Links to reliable sources of information on ADHD:
http://understood.org
http://chadd.org
http://add.org
http://additudemag.com

My video on Zombie ADHD myths & the truth behind them: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V5tLi1bYilA

And if you were one of the people who were hurt or offended by Nicole Arbour’s video (if not, it’s not worth watching/giving her views, it’s just one of her typical misinformed rants),
An excellent explanation of why she’s wrong: 
https://debunkingdenialism.com/2017/05/08/why-nicole-arbour-is-wrong-about-adhd/

And for taking me back month after month after month after month -- I know you were busy, and yet I never ran out of medication because you took the time to take me to every appointment.

localizations.es.title: Lo que deseo decirle a mi madre que me "drogaba"
localizations.es.description:
Medicar a un niño con TDAH es una decisión muy dura para muchos padres. Mi madre decidió ( como muchos padres hacen) enfrentarse a ser juzgada por sus elección de medicarme, a mí y a mi hermano. Aqui va algo que deseo decirle, a ella y a cada padre que se siente acusado por estar " drogando"  a sus hijos.

links:

Y si tu fuiste una de las personas lastimadas u ofendidas por el video de Nicole Arbour ( si no, no vale la pena mirarlo, ni darle a ella mas vistas) es una mas de sus típicas malinformadas expresiones.
Una excelente explicación de por que esta equivocada:
https://debunkingdenialism.com/2017/05/08/why-nicole-arbour-is-wrong-about-adhd/

Gracias a los que apoyan a través de Pantreon, con la posibilidad de hacer este video, corto y fácil de compartir. No hice mi usual introducción, pero no habría logrado esto sin Uds.
De paso, en caso que sean curiosos, ahora estoy medicada con Vyvanse, pero inicié con Ritalina.


Traducción del video:

Gracias.Gracias por escucharme cuando te decía que estaba sufriendo.
Gracias por defender mi posición cuando mi papa minimizaba lo que estaba atravesando como algo "normal".
Ahora entiendo que TDAH es altamente hereditario y creo que el debe de haber sentido eso, porque probablemente el tambien tenia TDAH.

Gracias por procurar obtener una evaluación apropiada, así pude entender las diferencias del funcionamiento de mi cerebro, y no sentir que "era todo culpa mía". Gracias por llevarme al psiquiatra mes tras mes, hasta encontrar una dosis apropiada, una que funcionara para mi.
Y por llevarme mes tras mes, tras mes, tras mes, tras mes, yo se que estabas ocupada, y así y todo jamas me quede sin medicación, porque te hiciste tiempo para llevarme a cada entrevista.

Gracias por ignorar a las personas que te juzgaron. Se que fueron muchas.

Gracias por entender que había una diferencia con mi hermana cuando ella ocasionalmente se olvidaba hacer su tarea, y yo olvidándome o perdiendo algo casi todos los dias. Gracias por entender que mientras todos los chicos pueden ser inquietos, impulsivos, tener hábitos nerviosos, o distraerse, yo sufría muchísimo mas que los demás chicos de mi misma edad. Ahora comprendo que es porque el cerebro con TDAH se desarrolla diferente.
Tu no sabias eso, no habías investigado lo que yo ahora, pero me escuchaste cuando te dije que necesitaba ayuda. 

Gracias a ti, yo tuve el tratamiento que necesitaba, me fue mejor en la escuela, sentí mas confianza en mi, mas capaz de alcanzar todo mi potencial. Gracias a ti, nunca necesite "automedicarme" como muchos "adedianos"que conozco. Nunca me hundí en depresión, nunca me di por vencida. Nunca me sentí malentendida. Tu me entendiste. Tu creíste en mi.

Y cuando lo hiciste, cuando me llevaste a un doctor que pudo explicarme lo que estaba sucediéndole a mi cerebro, tu hiciste que mi verguenza desapareciera. 
Gracias Mamá.

Enter translated description
localizations.it.title: Cosa voglio dire a mia madre, che mi ha "Drogata"
localizations.it.description:
Se (o come) medicare un  bambino con ADHD è una decisione comprensibilmente difficile per molti genitori. Mia madre ha deciso di farlo, ed ha affrontato il giudizio (come molti genitori) per le sue scelte di medicare me e mio fratello. Ecco quello che voglio dire a lei, e ad ogni genitore che viene accusato di “drogare” i propri figli. 

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Sostienici su Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

Link a fonti affidabili di informazioni sull'ADHD:
http://understood.org
http://chadd.org
http://add.org
http://additudemag.com

Il mio video sui miti Zombie sull'ADHD e la verità che c'è dietro: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V5tLi1bYilA

E se sei una delle persone che sono state ferite o offese dal video di Nicole Arbour (in caso contrario, non vale la pena guardarlo/darle visualizzazioni, è solo uno dei suoi tipici sproloqui disinformati),
Ecco un'eccellente spiegazione del perché si sbaglia: 
https://debunkingdenialism.com/2017/05/08/why-nicole-arbour-is-wrong-about-adhd/

la risposta di My Little Villagers': http://mylittlevillagers.com/2017/04/response-nicole-arbours-video-truth-adhd/

Grazie ai miei sostenitori su Patreon, per mantenere breve e condivisibile questo video non ho fatto la mia solita intro o wrapup, ma non avrei potuto fare tutto questo senza tutti voi. 

Tra l'altro, nel caso in cui qualcuno sia curioso - Prendo Vyvanse ora, ma ho iniziato con Ritalin. 

Trascrizione video:

Quello che voglio dire a mia madre, che mi ha "drogata":

Grazie. Grazie per avermi ascoltata quando ti ho detto che ero in difficoltà. Grazie per avermi sostenuta quando papà ha cercato di sminuire quello che stavo affrontando definendolo "normale". Ora capisco l'ADHD è altamente genetico ed è probabile che si sentisse così perché probabilmente aveva lui stesso l'ADHD.

Grazie per avermi portata a fare una valutazione clinica, così ora capisco le differenze del mio cervello e non mi sento come se fosse solo colpa mia. Grazie per avermi portata da uno psichiatra, mese dopo mese, per trovare un trattamento e la dose che ha funzionato per me. E per avermi portata di nuovo, mese dopo mese dopo mese dopo mese - So che eri occupata, eppure non ho mai finito i farmaci perché hai avuto il tempo di portarmi a ogni appuntamento.

Grazie per aver ignorato le persone che ti giudicavano. So che ce ne sono state molte.

Grazie per aver capito che c'era una differenza tra mia sorella che a volte dimenticava di fare i compiti e me che perdevo o dimenticavo qualcosa quasi tutti i giorni. Grazie per aver capito che, mentre tutti i bambini possono essere irrequieti o impulsivi o distrarsi, io facevo molta più fatica degli altri ragazzi della mia età. Ora capisco che è perché il cervello ADHD si sviluppa in modo diverso. 

Tu non lo sapevi che, non avevi fatto le ricerche che ho fatto io, ma mi hai ascoltato quando ti ho detto che avevo bisogno di aiuto.

Grazie a te, ho ottenuto il trattamento di cui avevo bisogno, sono andata meglio a scuola, mi sono sentita più sicura e in grado di raggiungere il mio potenziale. Grazie a te, non ho mai dovuto auto medicarmi come tanti ADHDers che conosco. Non sono mai caduta in depressione. Non mi sono mai data per vinta. Non mi sono mai sentita incompresa. Tu hai capito. Tu mi hai creduto. 

E quando lo hai fatto, quando mi hai portata da un medico che potesse spiegarmi che cosa stava accadendo nel mio cervello, mi hai portato via tanta vergogna.

Grazie mamma.
localizations.ko.title: 어린 내게 "약을 시킨" 우리 엄마에게 하고 싶은 말
localizations.ko.description:
많은 부모들에게 ADHD를 가진 아이를 치료할 것인지, 어떻게 치료할 것인지는 물론 어려운 결정입니다. 저희 엄마는 동생과 저에게 약물치료를 받도록 결정하고, (많은 부모들이 그렇듯) 비난을 받기로 결단했습니다. 이 이야기는 제가 엄마에게, 또 자식들에게 "약을 시켰"다고 추궁 당하는 모든 부모님들에게 해 주고 싶은 말입니다.

페이스북 : http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
트위터 : http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Patreon에서 후원해 주세요 : http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

ADHD에 관한 신뢰할 수 있는 정보 링크 (영어) :
http://understood.org
http://chadd.org
http://add.org
http://additudemag.com

저의 다른 영상인 -- 좀비같은 ADHD 미신들과 숨은 진실 (한글자막O) : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V5tLi1bYilA

만약 니콜 아버의 영상에 공격 받으신 분이라면 (아니시라면, 그 영상을 보거나 조회수를 올려줄 가치가 없답니다. 이 사람이 항상 그렇듯 잘못된 근거에 기반한 분노 표출이에요.)

여기 그 사람이 왜 틀렸는지 아주 잘 설명한 글입니다 (영어) :
https://debunkingdenialism.com/2017/05/08/why-nicole-arbour-is-wrong-about-adhd/

My Little Villagers 의 응답 (영어) : http://mylittlevillagers.com/2017/04/response-nicole-arbours-video-truth-adhd/

Patreon 후원자님들 감사해요. 영상을 짧고 공유하기 쉽게끔 하려고 평소처럼 인트로나 엔딩을 넣지 않았어요. 하지만 이 영상도 여러분 없이는 못했을 거예요.

참, 궁금한 사람이 있을지도 모르니까요 -- 저는 지금 바이반스Vyvanse를 복용하지만, 처음에는 리탈린Ritalin을 복용했어요.

영상 대본 (한글자막 대본) :

이 이야기는 "약을 시킨" 우리 엄마에게 제가 해주고 싶은 이야기입니다.

고마워요. 힘들다고 말씀드렸을 때 들어주셔서 고마워요. 제 증상이 평범한 거라며 무시하던 아빠한테 제 말이 맞다고 해주셔서 고마워요. 이제는 저도 이해해요. ADHD는 유전적인 질환이라 아빠도 제가 평범하다고 생각하셨겠죠. 왜냐하면 아빠도 아마 ADHD가 있었을 테니까요.

올바른 진단을 받을 수 있게 해 주셔서 고마워요. 덕분에 내 뇌의 다른 점들을 이해했고, 전부 내 탓이 아니란 걸 알 수 있었어요. 저에게 맞는 치료와 복용량을 찾아내기 위해 매달마다 신경정신과에 데려가 주셔서 고마워요. 그리고 계속해서 매달 매달 매달 데려가 주셨죠. 엄마가 바빴던 거 알아요. 그런데도 약이 떨어진 적이 없었어요. 엄마가 시간을 내서 매번 진료에 데려가 줘서요.

엄마를 비난하는 사람들을 무시해 줘서 고마워요. 많은 사람들이 그랬던 걸 알아요.

가끔씩 숙제를 잃어버리는 언니와 매일같이 뭔가를 잊거나 잃어버리는 제가 다르다는 걸 이해해 주셔서 고마워요. 모든 아이들이 가만히 못 있고, 충동적이고, 집중을 못할 수 있지만, 제가 또래 아이들보다 훨씬 힘들어했다는 걸 알아 주셔서 고마워요. ADHD 뇌가 다르게 발달하기 때문인 걸 이제는 알아요.

하지만 엄마는 모르셨죠. 엄마는 제가 알고 있는 연구들을 접하지 않으셨지만 제 말을 들어 주셨죠. 제가 도움이 필요하다고 했을 때요. 처방이 효과가 있다고 할 때도 들어 주셨죠.

엄마 덕분에 저는 필요했던 치료를 받았어요. 학교 공부도 더 잘했고, 자신감이 생겼어요. 저의 가능성을 펼칠 수 있었어요. 전 행운아였어요. 엄마 덕분에 저는 수많은 ADHD인들처럼 자가치료를 하지 않아도 됐어요. 우울증에 빠지지도 않았죠. 스스로를 포기한 적도 없어요. 오해받는다고 느낀 적도 없어요. 엄마가 이해해 줬잖아요. 엄마가 날 믿어줬어요.

엄마가 날 믿어 주고, 내 뇌를 설명해 줄 수 있는 의사에게 데려가 줬을 때, 엄마는 그 많은 수치심을 다 없애 준 거예요.

엄마 고마워.
localizations.ar.title: ما أريد أن أقوله لأمي ،التي أعتطني حبوب الدواء لاضطراب فرط الحركة وتشتت الانتباه (ADHD)
localizations.ar.description:
ما إذا كان (أو كيف) علاج طفل مصاب باضطراب فرط الحركة ونقص الانتباه قرار صعب بالنسبة للعديد من الآباء والأمهات. قررت أمي ، وواجهت (كما يفعل العديد من الآباء) الحكم على خياراتها. هنا ما أريد أن أقوله لها ، وكل والد يجد نفسه متهماً "بتخدير" أطفاله. 

الفيسبوك: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
تويتر: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
ادعمونا على Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

روابط لمصادر موثوقة للمعلومات عن اضطراب فرط الحركة ونقص الانتباه:
http://understood.org
http://chadd.org
http://add.org
http://additudemag.com

الفيديو الخاص بي على أساطير Zombie ADHD والحقيقة من وراءهم: https://www.youtube.com/watch؟v=V5tLi1bYilA

وإذا كنت أحد الأشخاص الذين تعرضوا للأذى أو الإساءة من فيديو نيكول أربور (إن لم يكن ، فإنه لا يستحق المشاهدة / إعطاء وجهات نظرها ، إنها مجرد واحدة من التشويهات الخاطئة النموذجية) ،
شرح ممتاز لماذا هي خاطئة: 
https://debunkingdenialism.com/2017/05/08/why-nicole-arbour-is-wrong-about-adhd/

رد My Little Villagers: http://mylittlevillagers.com/2017/04/response-nicole-arbours-video-truth-adhd/

أشكركم على مؤيدي باتريون ، من أجل إبقاء هذا الفيديو قصيرًا وقابل للمشاركة ، لم أقم بمقدمتي أو ملفي المعتاد ، لكنني لم أتمكن من فعل ذلك بدون جميعكم. 

بالمناسبة ، في حال كان أي شخص فضولي - أخذ Vyvanse الآن ، لكنني بدأت على Ritalin. 

نسخة من الفيديو:

ماذا أريد أن أقول لأمي التي "خدرت" لي:

شكرا لكم. أشكركم على الاستماع عندما أخبرتكم أنني أواجه صعوبة. أشكرك على وقوفك أمامي عندما حاول والدي استبعاد ما كنت أتعامل معه كـ "طبيعي". إنني أدرك الآن أن اضطراب فرط الحركة ونقص الانتباه جيني للغاية ومن المرجح أنه شعر بهذه الطريقة لأنه ربما يعاني من اضطراب فرط الحركة ونقص الانتباه بنفسه.

أشكركم على أخذني للحصول على تقييم مناسب حتى أتفهم اختلافات دماغي ولا أشعر أنها مجرد خطأي. شكرا لنقلني إلى طبيب نفسي ، شهر بعد شهر ، للعثور على العلاج والجرعة التي عملت بالنسبة لي. ولإعادتي الشهر بعد شهر بعد شهر بعد شهر - أعلم أنك كنت مشغولاً ، ومع ذلك لم أستنفد دوائي أبداً لأنك أخذت الوقت الكافي لأخذي إلى كل موعد.

شكرا لتجاهل الناس الذين حكموا عليك. وأنا أعلم أن هناك الكثير.

أشكرك على فهمك أن هناك اختلافًا بين أختي التي نسيتها في بعض الأحيان ، وفقدان أو نسيان شيئًا تقريبًا كل يوم. أشكركم على فهم أنه في حين أن جميع الأطفال يمكن أن يكونوا متوترين أو متسررين أو يشتت انتباههم ، إلا أنني كافحت أكثر من الأطفال الآخرين في عمري. أنا أفهم الآن لأن أدمغة ADHD تتطور بشكل مختلف. 

أنت لم تعرف ذلك ، أنت لم تقم بالبحث الذي قمت به ، لكنك استمعت لي عندما أخبرتك أنني بحاجة إلى المساعدة.

بسببك ، تلقيت العلاج الذي احتاجه ، وكنت أفضل في المدرسة ، شعرت بمزيد من الثقة وقادرة على الوصول إلى إمكانياتي. بسببك ، لم أضطر إلى العلاج الذاتي مثل الكثير من أدمينرز الذين أعرفهم. أنا لا غرقت في الاكتئاب. أنا لم أستسلم أبدا لم اشعر ابدا بسوء الفهم. أنت فهمت. أنت صدقتني 

وعندما فعلت ذلك ، عندما أخذتني إلى الطبيب الذي يمكن أن يشرح لي ما كان يحدث في عقلي ، كنت أخذت الكثير من العار.

شكرا يا امي
localizations.iw.title: מה שאני רוצה להגיד לאמא שלי ש"סיממה אותי"
localizations.iw.description:
השאלה האם לטפל תרופתית בילד עם הפרעת קשב וריכוז היא החלטה קשה להרבה הורים. אמא שלי החליטה לטפל בי ולהתמודד (כמו הורים רבים אחרים) עם שיפוטיות מהסביבה בקשר להחלטה שלה לתת לי ולאחי טיפול תרופתי. הנה מה שאני רוצה להגיד לה ולכל הורה שמוצא את עצמו מואשם שהוא "מסמם" את הילדים שלו.


Transcript of video:
זה מה שאני רוצה להגיד לאמא שלי ש"סיממה" אותי.

תודה. תודה שהקשבת כשאמרתי לך שקשה לי. תודה להגנת עלי כשאבא ניסה להקטין את את האתגרים שאיתם התמודדתי ולהגדיר אותם כ"נורמלים". עכשיו אני מבינה שהפרעת קשב היא ברובה תורשתית וזה סביר להניח שהוא הרגיש ככה מפני שהוא התמודד עם הפרעת קשב בעצמו.

תודה שלקחת אותי לאבחון מסודר כך שאני אוכל להבין את השונות במוח שלי ולא ארגיש כאילו שזו אשמתי. תודה שלקחת אותי לפסיאטר חוד אחרי חודש כדי למצוא את המינון שעובד בשבילי. ותודה על שהמשכת ולקחת אותי חודש אחרי חודש אחרי חודש אחרי חודש... אני יודעת שאת היית עסוקה. ועדיין מעולם לא נגמרו לי הכדורים משום שאת הקדשת את הזמן ולקחת אותי לכל פגישה.

תודה שהתעלמת מהאנשים ששפטו אותך. אני יודעת שהיו רבים כאלה. 

תודה שהבנת שיש הבדל ביני ובין אחותי שלפעמים שכחה את שיעורי הבית שלה וביני ששכחה או איבדה משהו כמעט כל יום. תודה שהבנת שלמרות שכל הילדים יכולים להיות תזזיתיים או אימפולסיביים או מוסחים אני נאבקת הרבה יותר מילדים אחרים בגילי. עכשיו אני מבחינה שזה משום שמוח עם הפרעת קשב מתפתח בצורה שונה.

את לא ידעת את זה, את לא עשית את המחקר שאני עשיתי, אבל את הקשבת לי כשאמרתי לך שאני צריכה עזר.

בזכותך קיבלתי את הטיפול שהייתי זקוקה לו, הצלחתי יותר בבית ספר, הרגשתי יותר בטוחה בעצמי וביכולות שלי ומיציתי את הפוטנציאל שלי. בזכותך מעולם לא הייתי צריכה למצוא חלופות עצמאיות לתרופה מו רבים מהילדים עם הפרעת קשב שאני מכירה. מעולם לא שקעתי בדיכאון. מעולם לא וויתרתי על עצמי. מעולם לא הרגשתי בלתי מובנת. את הבנת. את האמנת בי.

וכשאת לקחת אותי לרופא שיכול היה להסביר לי מה קורה במוח שלי את העלמת כל כך הרבה בושה

תודה אמא
localizations.no.title: Hva jeg vil si til min mor, som gav meg medisiner
localizations.no.description:
Å behandle et barn med ADHD er en forståelig tøff beslutning for mange foreldre. Moren min bestemte seg for, og møtte (som mange foreldre gjør) dom for hennes valg å medisinere meg selv og min bror. Her er hva jeg vil si til henne, og alle foreldre som finner seg selv anklaget for å "drikke" sine barn.

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Støtt oss på Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

Lenker til pålitelige kilder til informasjon om ADHD:
http://understood.org
http://chadd.org
http://add.org
http://additudemag.com

Min video om Zombie ADHD myter og sannheten bak dem: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V5tLi1bYilA

Og hvis du var en av de som ble skadet eller fornærmet av Nicole Arbors video (hvis ikke, det er ikke verdt å se / gi henne synspunkter, det er bare en av hennes typiske misinformerte rants),
En utmerket forklaring på hvorfor hun har galt:
https://debunkingdenialism.com/2017/05/08/why-nicole-arbour-is-wrong-about-adhd/

Mine små landsbyboere svar: http://mylittlevillagers.com/2017/04/response-nicole-arbours-video-truth-adhd/

Takk til mine Patreon-støttespillere, for å holde denne videoen kort og delelig, gjorde jeg ikke min vanlige intro eller wrapup, men jeg kunne ikke ha gjort dette uten alle dere.

Forresten, hvis noen er nysgjerrige, tar jeg Vyvanse nå, men jeg startet på Ritalin.

Transkripsjon av video:

Hva jeg vil si til mamma min, som "drog" meg:

Takk skal du ha. Takk for at du lyttet da jeg fortalte deg at jeg slitt. Takk for at du stod opp for meg da min far prøvde å avvise det jeg hadde å gjøre med som "normal". Jeg forstår nå at ADHD er svært genetisk og det er sannsynlig at han følte den måten fordi han sannsynligvis hadde ADHD selv.

Takk for at du tok meg for å få en skikkelig vurdering, slik at jeg forstår hjernens forskjeller og ikke føler at det bare er min feil. Takk for at du tok meg til en psykiater, måned etter måned, for å finne en behandling og dose som fungerte for meg. Og for å ta meg tilbake måned etter måned etter måned etter måned - jeg vet at du var opptatt, og likevel gikk jeg aldri ut av medisiner fordi du tok deg tid til å ta meg til hver avtale.

Takk for at du ignorerte de menneskene som dømte deg. Jeg vet at det var mange.

Takk for at du forstod at det var forskjell mellom søsteren min og noen ganger å glemme leksene sine og meg å miste eller glemme noe nesten hver dag. Takk for at du forstår at mens alle barn kan være fidgety eller impulsive eller bli distrahert, kjempet jeg langt mer enn de andre barna, min alder. Jeg forstår nå det er fordi ADHD-hjerner utvikler seg annerledes.

Du visste ikke det, du hadde ikke gjort forskningen jeg har, men du lyttet til meg da jeg fortalte deg at jeg trengte hjelp.

På grunn av deg fikk jeg den behandlingen jeg trengte, jeg gjorde det bedre på skolen, jeg følte meg mer trygg og i stand til å nå potensialet mitt. På grunn av deg, jeg måtte aldri selvmedisinere som så mange ADHDers jeg kjenner. Jeg sank aldri i depresjon. Jeg ga aldri opp på meg selv. Jeg har aldri følt meg misforstått. Du forstod. Du trodde på meg.

Og da du gjorde, da du tok meg til en lege som kunne forklare meg hva som skjedde i hjernen min, tok du så mye skam unna.

Takk mamma.
localizations.is.title: Það sem mig langar að segja við mömmu "sem dópaði mig."
localizations.is.description:
Hvort og hvernig eigi að meðhöndla barn með ADHD er erfið ákvörðun fyrir marga foreldra. Mamma ákvað að ég fengi meðhöndlun og eins og margir foreldrar verða fyrir, var hún dæmd  fyrir það. Hér er það sem mig langar að segja við hana og við alla foreldra sem finnst að aðrir dæmi þá fyrir "að dópa" barn sitt.
Þakka þér fyrir. Þakka þér fyrir að hlusta á mig þegar ég sagði þér að ég ætti erfitt. Þakka þér fyrir að standa með mér þegar pabbi reyndi að láta sem ekkert væri að mér, að ég væri eðlileg. Ég veit núna að ADHD er tengt erfðum og  hann hefur ef til vill sjálfur haft ADHD og þessvegna fundist ég vera eðlileg 
Þakka þér fyrir að fara með mig í greiningu svo ég fengi að vita hvernig heili minn vinnur og þurfi ekki að halda að þetta sé  allt mér að kenna. Þakka þér fyrir að fara með mig til geðlæknis, mánuð eftir mánuð til að finna meðferð og lyfjamagn sem hentaði mér. Og þú tókst þér tíma til að  fara svo aftur og aftur og aftur með mig, þó þú hafir haft nóg að gera, svo ég yrði ekki uppiskroppa með lyfin.  
Þakka þér fyrir að hunsa fólkið sem dæmdi þig, ég veit að margir gerðu það.

title: And The Winner of The How to ADHD Fidget Cube Giveaway Is…
description:
Who won? Watch to find out.

---The Agency.

facebook.com/howtoadhd
twitter.com/howtoadhd

Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

Official rules (reposted from now-destructed Giveaway Instructions):

OFFER: How to ADHD will give away an official Fidget Cube as the prize for the winner of each trivia question (aka “contest”) set forth in the “Fidget Cube Giveaway” video as determined by a random drawing (aka the high tech “hat” process) at the end of the contest. 

SUBMISSION PERIOD: Each contest begins when the “Fidget Cube Giveaway” video is posted and submissions must be received by Thursday, May 4, 2017 at 4:00 pm PST

PRIVACY POLICY: Any personal data collected from this contest will be used only for the purposes of this contest. 

HOW TO ENTER: All entries must be made by answering the trivia question for the fidget cube you wish to win in the comments of any How to ADHD video using the corresponding # (#dicecube, #gamercube, or #kickstartercube). Entries using the incorrect hashtag or no hashtag will be disqualified. 

**Limit one entry per person per question, multiple entries will be disqualified. Each comment counts as an entry. 

All entries must comply with YouTube Community Guidelines: https://www.youtube.com/yt/policyandsafety/communityguidelines.html

Winners for each contest will be chosen at random by the high tech “hat” process (random drawing).
Prizes are limited to one per winner. 


WINNER NOTIFICATION: Winners will be announced via a How to ADHD YouTube video within 24 hours of the contest ending. The potential winner must confirm their identity and eligibility through validated entries. No substitution, transfer or assignment of the prize will be permitted. The winner has 48 hours to respond to this prize notification or the prize may be forfeited and another winner chosen.

ELIGIBILITY: This giveaway is open to all legal residents of Earth who are 18 years of age or older or have their parents’ or legal guardian’s permission. Subscribing to How to ADHD is not required. How to ADHD employees, their immediate family members, as well as How to ADHD volunteers are not eligible for this giveaway. Only individual persons may participate; no entry or participation from any corporation or other entity shall be accepted or considered valid. By completing and submitting an entry form, each participant accepts the conditions and terms of these official rules. This giveaway is void outside the eligibility area and where otherwise prohibited by law. 

RESTRICTIONS: The “Fidget Cube Giveaway” is subject to change and/or cancellation at any time by How to ADHD without notice. Not valid where prohibited by law. How to ADHD is not responsible for technical, hardware or software malfunctions, lost or unavailable network connections, undeliverable email, or failed, incorrect, inaccurate, incomplete, garbled or delayed electronic communications, whether caused by the sender or by any of the equipment or programming associated with or utilized in this giveaway, or by any human error which may occur in the processing of the giveaway. If, in How to ADHD’s opinion, there is any suspected or actual evidence of tampering with any portion of the giveaway, or if technical difficulties compromise the integrity of either, How to ADHD reserves the right to terminate the giveaway or to modify it in a manner deemed appropriate by How to ADHD.

DISCLAIMER/RELEASE OF LIABILITY: Participation in this giveaway is done at your own risk. By entering, you agree to release How to ADHD and YouTube from any liability for injuries, loss or damages from participation in this giveaway. This promotion is sponsored entirely by How to ADHD. YouTube is not a sponsor of this contest.

SHIPPING: We will cover shipping to anywhere in the world that our post office allows us to ship to, and ship your prize within 7 days of the contest ending. 

If you do not have a YouTube account, you can enter by mailing a 3-x-5-inch postcard with your full name, address, with city, state, zip code, phone number, email address and age to:
Fidget Cube Giveaway! 
P.O. Box 1526
Guasti, CA 91743
ODDS OF WINNING: Odds of winning are based on the total number of qualified entries received during the giveaway period.
It is not necessary to subscribe to How to ADHD for a chance to win the prize, nor will subscribing increase your odds of winning a prize. 


*whew* that was a lot of jargon.

title: What Happened When I Stopped Taking My Medication
description:
As much as my meds help me, it’s a battle to remember to do all the things I need to do to be able to take them: sign up for health insurance, pay my bill, make a doctor appointment, GO to that appointment, get my prescription, find a pharmacy that can fill it, remember to pick it up before it closes, remember to bring my ID so they’ll let me...

So when I miss a step and find myself without my meds, it’s easy to wonder...are they really necessary?

This is what happened when I forgot to pay my health insurance, stopped taking my medication for two weeks and tried to learn how to live without it. 

Please share -- because the stigma is real, and no one should have to feel ashamed for getting the treatment they need just because their disorder is mental rather than physical, invisible rather than obvious. 

Mental health is just as important as physical health, and it’s time we acknowledge that.

*NOTE* -- I do not recommend going off medication without a doctor's supervision. A medical professional should be accessible to troubleshoot problems. If you can't reach your doctor, talk to a pharmacist. 

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

LINKS: 

Treatment Options: https://www.cdc.gov/ncbddd/adhd/treatment.html
Types of ADHD Medication: http://www.help4adhd.org/Understanding-ADHD/For-Parents-Caregivers/Treatment-Overview/Managing-Medication.aspx
Why Stimulants Work for ADHD: http://childrensmd.org/browse-by-age-group/why-do-stimulants-work-for-treatment-of-adhd/

The Stigma against ADHD: http://www.additudemag.com/adhd/article/2003.html
http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2015/10/27/adhd-stigma_n_8399902.html

Simone Biles taking a stand against the stigma: http://www.espn.com/espnw/voices/article/17602540/bravo-simone-biles-taking-stand-adhd-stigma

"The Show Must Be Go”, "Easy Lemon", "Life of Riley"
Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

localizations.de.title: Was passierte, als ich aufhörte, meine Medikamente zu nehmen
localizations.de.description:
So sehr mir Medikamente auch helfen, es ist trotzdem ein Kampf, all die Dinge zu erledigen, die notwendig sind, damit ich sie nehmen kann: eine Krankenversicherung abschließen, meine Rechnung zahlen, einen Arzttermin machen, zu diesem Termin auch GEHEN, ein Rezept bekommen, eine Apotheke finden, die mir die Medikamente verkaufen kann, daran denken, sie vor Ladenschluss abzuholen, an meinen Ausweis zu denken, damit sie sie mir auch geben...

Wenn ich also einen dieser Schritte vergesse und ohne Medikamente da stehe, fragt man sich schnell... Sind sie wirklich nötig?

Das hier passierte als ich vergessen hatte, meine Krankenversicherung zu bezahlen, zwei Wochen lang keine Medikamente nahm und versuchte, zu lernen, ohne sie zu leben.

Bitte teilt es -- denn das Stigma ist echt, und niemand sollte sich dafür schämen, die notwendige Behandlung in Anspruch zu nehmen, nur weil ihre Krankheit psychisch und nicht körperlich ist, unsichtbar statt offensichtlich.

Psychische Gesundheit ist genauso wichtig wie körperliche, und es wird Zeit, dass wir das anerkennen.

*HINWEIS* -- Ich empfehle nicht, die Medikamente ohne ärztliche Betreuung abzusetzen. Ein Mediziner sollte erreichbar sein, um bei Problemen einzugreifen. Falls Ihr Euren Arzt nicht erreichen könnt, fragt Euren Apotheker.

localizations.nl.title: Wat er gebeurde toen ik stopte met mijn medicatie
localizations.nl.description:
Ondanks dat mijn meds mij veel helpen, is en blijft het een strijd om er aan te denken alle dingen te doen die ik moet doen om ze te kunnen blijven nemen: mij aanmelden voor de ziektekostenverzekering, het betalen van de rekening, een afspraak maken met mijn arts, naar die afspraak GAAN, mijn recept krijgen, het vinden van een apotheek die ze kan verstrekken, er aan denken ze op te halen voordat de apotheek sluit én er aan denken om mijn legitimatie mee te nemen zodat ze me de pillen ook meegeven...

Dus als ik een stap mis en opeens zonder mijn meds zit, is het makkelijk om me af te vragen... zijn ze echt nodig?

Dit is wat er gebeurde toen ik vergat om mijn zorgverzekering te betalen, twee weken stopte met mijn medicatie en probeerde te leren hoe te overleven zonder. 

Deel dit alsjeblieft - want het stigma is echt. Niemand hoeft zich te schamen voor het krijgen van de behandeling die ze nodig hebben, alleen maar omdat hun stoornis een mentale is in plaats van fysieke, onzichtbaar in plaats van overduidelijk. 

Geestelijke gezondheid is even belangrijk als de lichamelijke gezondheid, en het is tijd dat we dat erkennen.

* LET OP! * - Ik adviseer je om niet te stoppen met je medicatie zonder toezicht van je huisarts. Hou een medisch professional bij de hand voor het oplossen van problemen. Als je jouw huisarts niet kunt bereiken, overleg dan met je apotheker.

localizations.es-419.title: Lo que suceció cuando dejé de tomar la medicación
localizations.es-419.description:
A pesar de lo que me ayudan los medicamentos, es una lucha recordar todas las cosas que necesito hacer para poder tomarlos: registrarme en el seguro de salud, pagar las boletas, pedir una cita con el médico, ir al médico, pedir la prescripción médica, encontrar la farmacia que pueda proveerlo, recordar retirarlo antes de que cierre, recordar llevar mi identificación personal para que ellos me dejen...

Por lo que cuando olvido uno de los pasos y me encuentro sin medicamentos, resulta muy fácil preguntarme... son realmente necesarios?

Esto es lo que sucedió cuando olvidé pagar la cuota de mi seguro de salud, dejé de tomar la medicación durante dos semanas e intentar aprender a vivir sin ellos.

Por favor, comparte, porque el prejuicio es real, y nadie debería sentirse avergonzado por llevar el tratamiento que requieren sólo porque su dificultad es mental y no física, invisible más que obvia...

La salud mental es tan importante como la salud física y es hora de que lo aprendamos.

Nota: no recomiendo dejar la medicación sin la supervisión de tu médico. Un médico profesional debería ser accesible para cualquier problema. Si no encuentras a tu médico, habla con el farmacéutico.

localizations.ko.title: ADHD 약을 끊었을 때 일어난 일!
localizations.ko.description:
약이 도움이 되긴 하지만, 약을 얻기 위해서 해야 하는 그 모든 일들을 기억하기란 난투 같아요. 보험에 가입하고, 보험료를 내고, 진료 예약을 하고, 예약 시간에 가고, 처방전을 받고, 약국을 찾고, 약국이 닫기 전에 약을 찾으러 가고, 약을 받을 때 내밀어야 되는 신분증을 챙기고...

그래서 저 단계들 중 하나를 빼먹고, 약이 떨어진 상태가 되면 이런 질문을 하게 되죠... 약이 정말 필요한 건가?

이 영상에는 제가 보혐료를 내기를 까먹고, 약을 2주간 끊은 뒤에 약 없이 지내는 법을 배워보려고 했을 때 생긴 일들을 담았어요.

꼭 공유해 주세요! 사회적 낙인은 정말 존재하니까요. 단지 장애가 신체적이지 않고 정신적이라는 이유로, 겉으로 잘 드러나지 않는다는 이유만으로, 필요한 처치를 받는 일에 누구도 죄책감을 느껴서는 안 됩니다.

정신건강은 몸의 건강만큼이나 중요하고, 이제는 그 사실을 인지해야 합니다.

*주의* -- 의사의 감독 없이 약을 끊는 것은 추천하지 않습니다. 문제가 생겼을 때 해결하기 위해서 의료 전문가에게 연락할 수 있어야 합니다. 의사에게 연락할 수 없는 상황이라면, 약사에게 상담하세요.

localizations.da.title: Hvad Der Skete Da Jeg Stoppede Med at Tage Min Medicin
localizations.da.description:
Ligeså meget som min medicin hjælper mig, er det en kamp at skulle huske alle de ting jeg skal, for jeg rent faktisk kan tage den: skrive mig op til sygesikring, betale min regning, aftale en tid med min læge, rent faktisk MØDE OP til den aftalte tid, få min recept, finde et apotek der kan udfylde recepten, huske at hente den inden de lukker, huske mit ID så jeg må hente hente det.

Så når jeg misser et punkt, og pludselig ikke har min medicin, så kommer jeg til at undre mig...har jeg virkelig brug for dem?

Det var det der skete da jeg glemte at betale for min sygesikring, stoppede med at tage min medicin i 2 uger, og prøvede at lære at leve uden.

Vær venlig at del-- fordi stigmatiseringen omkring det er ægte, og ingen burde føle skam over at få den behandling de har brug for, bare fordi deres lidelse er mental, og ikke fysisk. Næsten usynlig.

*OBS*-- Jeg anbefaler ikke at stoppe med at tage medicin uden at stale med en læge først. Der burde være en læge tilgængelig for fejlfinding af problemer. Hvis du ikke kan få fat på din læge, prøv så i stedet en farmaceut.

localizations.el.title: Τι Συνέβη Όταν Σταμάτησα να Παίρνω τα Φάρμακά μου
localizations.el.description:
Όσο κι αν με βοηθούν τα φάρμακά μου, είναι μια μάχη να θυμάμαι όλα τα πράγματα που πρέπει να κάνω για να μπορώ να τα πάρω: να υπογράψω για ασφάλεια υγείας, να πληρώσω το λογαριασμό μου, να κλείσω ραντεβού με το γιατρό, να ΠΑΩ σε αυτό το ραντεβού, να πάρω τη συνταγή μου, να βρω ένα φαρμακείο που να μπορεί να την καλύψει, να θυμηθώ να πάω να πάρω τα φάρμακα πριν κλείσει το φαρμακείο, να θυμηθώ να πάρω την ταυτοτητά μου μαζί για να με αφήσουν να πάρω τα φάρμακα...

Οπότε όταν χάνω ένα βήμα και βρίσκομαι χωρίς τα φάρμακά μου, είναι εύκολο να αναρωτηθώ... είναι όντως απαραίτητα;

Να τι συνέβη όταν ξέχασα να πληρώσω την ασφάλεια υγείας, σταμάτησα να παίρνω το φάρμακό μου για 2 εβδομάδες και προσπάθησα να μάθω πώς να ζω χωρίς αυτό.

Παρακαλώ μοραστείτε το βίντεο - γιατί το στίγμα είναι αληθινό, και κανείς δε θα έπρεπε να νιώθει ντροπή που παίρνει τη θεραπεία που χρειάζεται, απλώς επειδή η διαταραχή τους είναι νοητική, αντί για φυσική, αόρατη αντί για προφανής.

Η νοητική υγεία είναι το ίδιο σημαντική με τη φυσική, και είναι ώρα να το αναγνωρίσουμε.

*ΣΗΜΕΙΩΣΗ* - Δεν προτείνω να σταματήσει κάποιος/α τη φαρμακευτική αγωγή χωρίς επίβλεψη γιατρού. Ένας επαγγελματίας γιατρός θα πρέπει να είναι προσβάσιμος για την αντιμετώπιση προβλημάτων. Αν δεν μπορείς να βρεις το γιατρό σου, μίλησε σε φαρμακοποιό.

title: How to Cope When Everything's Awful and You're Not Okay
description:
Sometimes everything is awful and you’re not okay.  That’s okay.  Here’s how to cope.  A self-care checklist. The one I go through here designed by Eponis Sinope to help battle depression, but I encourage you to add to it or create your own! 

This is the full version for the ADHD tribe, check out the short, shareable, checklist-only version here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ek-B_EZyoM8

And check out the original tumblr post by Eponis Sinope here: http://eponis.tumblr.com/post/113798088670/everything-is-awful-and-im-not-okay-questions-to

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd

Special thanks to Daniel Alfaro for shooting/directing me practicing self care!

description:
Hello brains!  Eric Tivers is back for the third and final installment of managing your time!  In part three, I do my best to find every possible problem an ADHD'er could have while setting up a schedule – and Eric fires back every time with great ideas!

tags: ['livestream', '50k', 'subscriber', 'announcement', 'live', 'stream', 'add', 'adhd', '2017', 'goals', 'one page miracle', 'resolutions', 'new years', 'special', 'youtuber', 'vidcon', 'nextup', 'live stream', 'anniversary', 'celebration']
title: 50K SUBSCRIBER LIVE STREAM ANNOUNCEMENT!
description:
50K Subscriber Livestream Announcement!!!
Livestream starts at 5:24

Just a quick livestream to let you know we'll be doing a BIG, ONE YEAR ANNIVERSARY live stream here on the channel at on Thursday, January 5, at 7PM Pacific.

Here's the direct link for the live stream: http://youtube.com/HowtoADHD/live

In the live stream:

We'll review my One Page Miracle from the first episode of the show, and see how far I've progressed!

We'll share some of YOUR goals from 2016 (tell us how you did!) or for 2017 (tell us about your goal!).  To submit your goals for the live stream, email me at: howtoadhd@gmail.com  with the subject line: #LIFEGOALS  (include your name or your YouTube username)

There'll also be a live Q&A session!

A cameo appearance by EDWARD!

And two REALLY BIG SPECIAL ANNOUNCEMENTS!

You can get your own copy of the One Page Miracle from the description of my first video: 

How to Keep Focused on Your Goals in the New Year!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kzbUcyNFjqA

See you then, brains!

title: How to Manage Your Time With Eric Tivers (Part One)
description:
It's been a busy first year for the show! But I still can't bring myself to stick to a schedule. Since sleep is important, Eric Tivers joins us to talk about how to manage time in a way that's...well, less scary. He had so much great advice we couldn't fit it all in one episode -- subscribe for more, coming soon!

Eric's website: http://ADHDreWired.com
Coaching Group: http://coachingrewired.com

**Special Webinar on Time Blindness: Friday Dec. 30th at 1 PM CST -- "Productivity Solutions for the Time-Blind." 
I saw Eric do this presentation at the CHADD conference and it was AMAZING. The webinar is free, you just have to register! erictivers.com/events.



Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd
Twitter: http://twitter.com/howtoadhd
Support us on Patreon: http://patreon.com/howtoadhd


2 hour glitter jar: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7fFNrl6czf4
How to Deal With ADHD Meltdowns: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yfg3ThEm-gY
How to Fight Your Procrastination Anxiety: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IoJx9sXeP34
ADHD and Relationships: Let's Be Honest: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XbyN8REIhMk
How to Get to Sleep When You Have ADHD: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zbhUFX6ZRYA
How to Study: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PZ4wWpPf-go
How to Fight the Paper Monster: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NnRG3D7VH4k


"The Show Must Be Go”, “Life of Riley”

title: My First Unboxing Video! New Equipment I Don't Know How to Use!!!
description:
Check out my first unboxing video!! This is my new equipment haul from B&H photo from the gift card YouTube gave us as winners of the NextUP competition. I...still don't know how to use most of it, but the creator camp taught me the basics and gave me the confidence that I could learn whatever else I need to know! Who says you can't be #ADHDandSuccessful. 

The cute redhead from NextUP (beginning of the video): https://www.youtube.com/koolysmiley

The YouTube NextUP competition: https://www.youtube.com/yt/nextup/?noapp=1

Facebook: http://facebook.com/howtoadhd

title: How to Win Christmas: Fantastic Presents for People with ADHD
description:
This is a very special Christmas episode, made by...YOU! I asked you what you wanted for Christmas, and these were your ideas! Thank you so much for an incredible first holiday season of How to ADHD, love you all!!!! 

The Brain's Holiday Gift Tracker: http://bit.ly/ADHDGiftOrgplain
Updated pretty version: http://bit.ly/ADHDGiftOrgshiny
(Lots of thanks to Jo and Edward for making this idea come to life! I am...terrible at Photoshop. Thanks guys!) 

My PO Box (send Xmas cards!!! :D)
Jessica @ How to ADHD
P.O. Box 1526
Guasti, CA 91743-9001

title: Overwhelm Part 2: How to Fight the Paper Monster
description:
Hello brains!

Thanks for your patience on this one, I think I underestimated my paper monster (and overestimated my ability to run 2 cameras, tackle paper clutter, and explain how to tackle paper clutter all at the same time). Hope you enjoy Overwhelm Part 2 and that this video helps you as much as having to make it helped me!!

What to keep: https://www.dailyworth.com/posts/3513-when-to-throw-away-financial-documents

P.S. -- I got a P.O. Box! And I'm all caught up on my mail now, so I'd love to get more! (no food stuffs please) 

Jessica @ How to ADHD
P.O. Box 1526
Guasti, CA 91743-9001
